111.content:
alright let's do this thing but first a bit of back story.

You had just gotten your first command, while not always being the brightest in training you had always been reasonably quick thinking and you always tried your hardest to keep casualties to a minimum. You walked toward your new ship the "________" you looked at her magnificent bow and the massive engine system as you walked through the landing tunnel. you turned to your left and saw you best friend and second in command Quentus nicknamed "Q" by you when you first met each other. You turned and asked "are you sure you want to come? What about Emily and the kids?" you asked gently knowing they had died less than a month ago.
"I'll be fine, sir."
"Q you don't need to call me that we've already been over this."
"I know sir but I feel it's only right."
As you boarded the ship a waft of cleaning spray smell hit you in the face. you turned to the left and saw this ship has been cristened the _____ by the I.F.O.H.
111.title: massive

1111.content:
As you entered the ship you saw that the Nimitz was everything you'd expected. The airlock was connected to the hanger. you saw the fighters lining the walls. you knew there were at least two underneath the landing bay were pilots could mount up and be launched as soon as the rest were out of it's way. You turned right and saw a elevator and a stairwell.
"Q, where does that elevator lead?"
"To munitions storage sir."
you walk up the stairs that lead to the CIC were you would command the ship. when you got there you saw faces. most of them around 20 or 30. most of them had never seen combat before neither had you. they all stopped and saluted as Q yelled out "Commander on deck!"
"at ease gentlemen." you said
one person who sat in the comm officers seat said to you "sir what are our orders?"
You turned to look and saw that the person was a Caucasian male about 27 years old he had red hair and his name tag read lt. Jazen Parker.
"Our orders are to head out to a human colony called Greensburg in the Hempsfield system. There we will stay until our next orders come."
1111.title: Nimitz

11111.content:
You sit in your chair.
"System report!"

"engines are energized and ready for use."
"weapons and defense systems are online sir!"
"shields and thrusters are online."

"take off in five...
four...
three...
two...
one....
Nimitz...takeoff!"

You hear the engire roar to life and propel you into the starry sky.
You and everyone else in thrown back into their seats by the force of the takeoff.
Entering the orbital atmosphere, you all begin to relax.

"Status...how we holding up?"
One young woman stands and faces you.

"Things look ok so far sir, but we are getting a weird reading 30 clicks ahead of us."
"Show it on screen."
A large virtual screen appears and what is shown heading for you makes your heart sink.

It is a bertanian Space swallower....giant sloth-like creatures that roam the edges of space and swallow ships like yours whole.
Your crew begins to stir and panic.
"Everyone remain calm and stay at your stations!
how long before it reaches us?"

The young woman works feverishly at her station.
"Less than 30 seconds sir!"
You have to make a choice....

Activate your weapons systems and try to fight the creature...

OR....

Put up the shield and try to outrun the monstrosity....
11111.title: BIG trouble

1113.content:
The ship had been Christened: 'Rising Dawn'

Since the war had started a few years ago against a rebellious faction, ships had been lost on all sides. The ship you were commanding was definately not the biggest ship in the navy, but it was a special one.

I.F.O.H Blade-Class Frigate 'Rising Dawn'

"Well, she is a beauty" You said, walking onto the loading elevator which was currently extended. Several servicemen were struggling to tie down a large vehicle that resembled a tank onto the loading ramp, although the tank was perfectly fit for the job, the servicemen were rookies and it took far longer to finish the job than it would have taken a group of battle-seasoned veterans. One of the rookie servicemen noticed you standing in the corner of the large elevator and ushered the rest of them to hurry up. You almost felt like telling them to take their time and get it right. You were in no rush.

Finally, they finished and the loading ramp slowly started to ascend into the ship. You looked down before the gap closed and saw just how many people were rushing about to get this ship ready for departure. So many people who were going to be under your command. You looked around the hangar in which you were now in. It was basically divided into two parts, where the elevator was and where everything else was stored.

This ship wasnt big enough for a battalion of fighters, but it did have two brand new landing craft which were outfitted with a few light weapons for ground combat. You walked out of the hangar and headed for the bridge. People were moving too and fro, installing the last bits of walling and making sure that everything was locked tight. As soon as they saw your rank though, they immediately stopped and saluted. You hated that. Saluting always drove you nuts. So you quickly waved them off and told them to keep working.

The bridge was just as busy, as people finished installing the last few parts and ensured that all the systems were functioning and their expected capacity. A man was about to yell "Captain On Deck" but you silenced him. You were certain that the best way to see how your crew truly worked was to see them when they thought you were not around.

You left the bridge and headed for your own dormitory, conveniently located just outside the bridge. Sitting down in your own personal armchair which you had brought from your dormitory in the academy, you brought up the ship schematics to review them and help yourself memorise. It was uncommon for captains to change ships unless their previous ship was retiring or too badly damaged.

The computer happily hummed into life and displayed the relevant information...

"I.F.O.H Blade-Class Frigate: 'Rising Dawn'
Length: 535 meters
Width: 295 meters

Ship Weapons:
- One Type 8, Class 10 Forward Railgun
- Eight heavy point chainguns (Four per side)
- Four Munition Launch Tubes
- Four hangar defense turrets
- Forty Eight corridor defense turrets

Complement:
- Total: 450
- Marines
- Operational Crew
- D899 Atmospheric Transport Landing And Surveillance Vehicle (ATLAS Craft) (4x)
- Orbital Insertion Pods (20x)

Engine:
- Four Viking Class Propulsion Engines
- Four Viking Class Maneuvering Thrusters
- One Intrepid Class Translight Drive (Estimated Life expectancy: 20 years)

Shielding:
- Four Frontal AXEL Class Shield Emitters
- Two Rear AXEL Class Shield Emitters

-----

Your ship was impressive, and you were more than happy to be in charge of 449 crew members - you being crew member #450: The Captain.
The ship was the first of its class, with only another 19 expected. It was a special class, designed specifically to work alone with the intention of causing as much harm to the enemy while also being a legendary symbol of peace, small for its size, big on versatility.

The computer bleeped at you, saying a new call was coming in from I.F.O.H Command.

"Morning Captain. I see you seem to be still fitting in that armchair of yours quite well" Fleet Commander Jason Horst said. He was your tutor briefly at the captains academy and you were quite glad that he was the first person to be talking to you.
"Thank you Commander. There's nothing like a captains chair"
"Don't wear it down too well. You can replace a good chair easily"
"I'll keep that in mind" You said happily. "How can I help you today?"

"Well, I'm sure your settling into your ship now, but I decided to give you the first chance to pick one of three missions since you'll be the first ship out of dock for the next few days. Your welcome to spend a few hours mulling over them but when you do decide, you'll be heading out as soon as everyone on that fine ship of yours gives you the green light.
1113.title: I.F.O.H Blade-Class Frigate: 'Rising Dawn'

choices: It's all over, do a quick check in the mess and then head to Ceaser Station
11131.content:
Commander Horst sent the relevant mission files through to you and said farewell. You relaxed in your chair and mulled over the three different missions. You could take any of them at your point and the decision rested completely on you. The mission to spy on a potential threat looked really interesting, but you really wanted to see how your crew would handle in a potential firefight.

It was tradition that the first crew for a captain was actually picked by other captains, as you had done for other people in the academy. By all intentions, it was expected that captains receieved well trained crew, but the entire purpose was to ensure that crews knew how to work together despite never having seen each other before. It was a highly effective method that had been going on for years.

You decided on the Supply Line Disruption mission and called Commander Horst back.

"I thought you'd take that one!" He laughed. "Seemed right up your alley. I'll send through more information now. Should be a really easy job, just go in there, tear up a few rebels and then tarry on back to the Ceaser Station in a nearby system for a post mission report. Enjoy yourself."

Fleet Admiral Jason Horst was still laughing a bit when he finished the call. You two had gotten along extremely well in the academy, which explained why you were the first captain out of dock.
The computer bleeped at you again. A face you recognised appeared. Osman, the guy in charge of engineering.
"Captain, we're all ready down here for when you want to depart. Engines have been spinning happily for the past hour"
"Thanks Osman. We'll be leaving shortly"
"Sure thing, oh and... Captain?"
"Yes Osman?"
"Thanks for all this. I'm really glad to be working with you"
The call ended. Horst must have talked to some of the crew and exaggerated your skills.

Another call came through in about ten minutes while you finished up reading the mission documents. This time it was one of the technicians who wasnt going to stay on the ship.
"Captain? We're all done fitting everything around here and I'm the last one to leave. Your armoury officer told me to tell you he's busy checking the last of the weapons but apparently he's all happy. Communications has been running fine for the past few days - as evident by our call now. Anything else you need before I leave?"
"Thanks guys, you did a really good job here and I'm impressed. Go get yourself a drink in the mess"
"Thanks alot sir! Goodluck out there!"
The call ended.

You left your dormitory and headed into the bridge. The same guy from before managed to yell out Captain On Deck before you could silence him. You'd need to make a note of that. Everyone stopped looking at their console, stood up and saluted you.
"Good morning everyone. Glad your all here. I'm Captain John Macree and I'm hoping we'll all get to know each other well and have some good missions. There's just three things I want to set down before we depart. First, I want you to all work at the same rate regardless of whether or not I am around. Second, I will do my best to not expect anything beyond what I believe your capable of. Lastly, the next person who yells "Captain On Deck" OR salutes me gets shot in the throat. I really hate that"

Everyone blinked at you. The guy who yelled out before shrunk away slightly but you gave a light smile. If you didnt instil in this crew that YOU were in charge, this wasnt going to be a nice career.

----------

"Helmsman" You said, sitting in your chair in the middle of the room. "Take us out"
"Aye sir" Came the reply from a man in front. It would take you a while to learn everyones names.

You felt the engines rumble into life, the power in them pushing against the metal clamps which once held this ship together as it was constructed. The clamps disengaged and folded back into the ground, allowing your ship to rise into the air and fly high into the sky.

You soon broke through the edge of the atmosphere, heading past one of the defensive platforms setup around Earth an extremely long time ago. It's slowly blinking lights signifying 'Please don't ram me'. You sailed on past it, far clearer than the minimum distance allowed.

"Helmsman, set course for Sector X39, activate Translight Drive" You commanded.
"Aye sir" He said again. The ship changed course, the rim of Earth appearing just below the main viewport outside the front of the bridge. A massive blue energy portal appeared infront of the ship, a swirl of blue and purple colours moving in and out. The ship moved forward, into the portal, dissappearing from Earth and the solar system.

Here, was the translight realm, where moving a few meters meant kilometers in the normal realm. It would take a total of two hours to reach the next system. Outside the viewport, everything was black, there was no indication that you were actually moving, just the Translight Drive humming away. Thats what scared people about this realm though, the total blackness - no stars - nothing. Many passenger cruisers actually automatically closed their windows in order to prevent people from becoming unsettled.

"Tactical Officer, report" You said.
"Here and ready Sir" Came the reply from your left.
"Prepare the Forward Railgun for a single round upon exit of Translight. Make sure the point weapons are all ready for immediate firing upon exit"
"Cycling up the coils Sir. Point Weapons ready" He replied. According to your report, your tactical officer was a keen fanatic on big explosions. "Preparing for a battle are we Sir?"
"I'm actually more keen on how big of an explosion we can make in the first volley" You said. The tactical officer beamed.
"Uhh, Captain?" The Helmsman said.
"Yes Helmsman?" You replied.
"I just checked the Star Map, there's nothing there but an empty large asteroid orbiting a small sun. Several recon reports over the last few months confirm there being nothing."

"Time for a mission briefing then" You smiled. Everyone turned to you. "According to very recent intel, rebels have setup a small warehouse on the asteroid, which is cutting several of their supply runs in half. We destroy the warehouse and we put a big kink in their plans. Recon also suggests that the rebels don't know that we know about it yet, so the depot will be extremely lightly manned, only a few point guns which we can easily stay out of effective range of"

Everyone nodded in response, happily understanding why you were going there.

----------

Your journey was up and you exited Translight as swiftly as you had entered it, approaching the warehouse directly from above. Hopefully they had some terrible sensor equipment.
"Tactical Officer. Fire when ready"

You felt a massive discharge as the Forward Railgun fired above you, slightly shaking the ship. The projectile was like a bullet, going exponentially faster through each coil. Except unlike a bullet, this was a small nuke specially designed for Forward Rail Guns. Since space doesnt transmit sound, all you saw was the fiery explosion of the warehouse on the asteroid as it seperated from the surface, pieces drifting into space.
11131.title: X7089301: Supply Line Disruption

111312.content:
Before you could instruct your helmsman to scan the wreckage for survivors, the ship shook and all the electronics sparked and shivered. It was as if a massive discharge of something had hit the ship and knocked it off course.
"Captain! There's an unidentified object behind us and it's charging its main weapons!" The helmsman said.
"Sensors can't see the target but visual sightings can confirm its existence!" Someone else cried out.
"Captain, we've lost the main railgun for now, but three point weapons are still active"
"Fire!" You yelled. "If you cant target them with the computer, bring up a camera and shoot them out of space!"

Your weapons officer wasnt hesitant to bring all three guns to bear. They began spinning and firing volleys of bullets at the rogue ship, which was caught unawares and didnt have enough time to raise its shields. The bullets tore through the hull, moving form the front right down to the rear. They must have hit a critical system, because the engines suddenly exploded in a massive cloud of yellow and blue fire. There was nothing worthwhile of the ship left to scan.

"Everyone okay?" You asked, still tense.
"Damage reports still coming in" An officer said.

"Captain? What the hell was that?" Osman in engineering came over the comms.
"Another ship that we didnt expect... It's dead now"
"Well could you warn me next time you expect something like that?"
"Will do"

"Minimal physical damage to the ship. The weapon was an EMP weapon designed to knock us dead in the water. Fortunately their targeting was off a little so we got lucky. Most systems are coming back only but the EMP also caused a few electrical shocks to occur throughout the ship. Minor burns are being treated in the medical wing. Except for one person."
"One person? Who?" You asked.
"Lt. Quentus Markuss"

Your eyes went wide. Your best friend had been hit by an electrical blast.
"Helmsman, set course for Ceaser Station, activate Translight Drive. I'll be in medical"
"Aye Sir"

You walked slowly out of the bridge. You didnt know why Q hadnt come to the bridge yet, but he must have been busy with something. You arrived shortly in the medical bay, but two marines refused your entry.
"I'm Captain here, let me in" You instructed firmly.
"We're aware sir. Under any other conditions, we'd let you in" One of the Marines replied. He almost looked scared to disobey your order.
"We'll then why wont you let me?"
"Lt. Quentus asked us to stop you"

That was as good a reason as any.
"Have his doctor send me the medical report"
"Will do Captain"

Two hours passed as you headed to Ceaser Station. The medical report came in, though the doctor was hesitant to give it. Apparnetly Q was adamant that you couldnt see him in this state.
"I'm sorry Captain, but it doesnt look good. The electrical dischage hit him directly in the face. There's a lot of burnt skin and although he'll recover just fine, there's going to be permanent scarring on his face, both arms and his left leg.
"How big was the discharge?" You asked.
"Honestly? I'm surprised he's alive. I'm not sure what speech you gave to inspire him, but it sure must have been a good one"
"Mhm... Thanks Doc"

Another hour passed before Q's Doctor called you back.
"Lt. Quentus is awake now, he's asked to speak to you"
"Put him through - though I'd like to know why I cant see your camera"
"He asked for it"
You sighed. There was no point in fighting Q on this - especially after what happened to his family.
"How you doing?" You asked, trying to fake a smile. You knew he could see you.
"Glad your okay" Came a hoarse voice, followed by a large cough.
"Apparently your going to make a full recovery"
"Your okay and still a terrible liar. I know what happened to me." He said.
Your smile faded slightly.
"Looks like I'm already out of the game" Q said. "Havent even seen out of the front of the bridge yet"
"I'm not giving up on you"
"Oh don't do that. Once I can walk again we'll see if I can come back" He said. The coughing returned, this time even worse and his doctor hung up.

----------

After arriving at Ceaser Station, the techs there had a quick look at the ship and then said it was fine. After sending your report to Earth, Commander Horst quickly phoned you.

"I'm sorry about what happened to Q" He started. "We are aware of the type of ship you encountered but didnt have any confirmed reports until now. We honestly didnt expect something like this to happen so far from the front lines"
"I know" You said, biting your lips.
"High command has decided to rule heavily in your favour on this, due to the unusual circumstances. Unfortunately, you'll need a new second-in-command until Q is back on his feet"
"Something tells me I wont like this"
"There's only one person nearby who can fit the job. And to top it off, she's currently sitting in the brig of Ceaser Station." Horst said.
"This is all almost too convenient" You muttered.
"If you dont want her, your welcome to come back to Earth and find another. I want to warn you though, she's literally one of the best out of the academy"
"If she's so good, why's she in the brig?"
"How about we make your next mission to tame her? She's a wild girl, hates the chain of command but is a bloody good tactician and incredibly smart."
"Whats her name?" You asked.
"Lt. Alanna Jamieson" Horst said, biting his lip
111312.title: Q's short lived excursion...

choices: Alanna couldnt care less about you and stays.
1113121.content:
"Any deadline on my decision?"
"One day" Horst said.
"I'll go talk to her"
"Have fun. Just remember her bark is far worse than her bite"
Horst logged off and you thought about your wonderful new task. You left your dorm and walked onto the bridge. "I'm going on the station for an hour or so. Helmsman, your in charge"
"Okay sir" The Helmsman said.
"And I think its about bloody time I learnt your name..."
"Third Officer Samuel Jackson" He said. He didnt expect at all for the captain to care about his name.
"Alright. And, Tactical Officer?"
"Yes?"
"Name..."
"Oh. Fourth Officer Ashley Wilson"
"Excellent. I'll be back soon"

You left the ship through the docking bay and Ceaser Station's First Officer welcomed you on board.
"So, ye gonna talk some sense into the lass in the Brig aye?" He asked as you walked. His voice held a thick scottish accent.
"Indeed. Apparently she's my new second in command"
The Officer laughed. "Well then! Your in for a right treat you are! She can't go ten minutes withoot runnin' her mouth off! I'd have shown her what space was really like if I'd been aloowed!"
"I have a feeling I'll be thinking the same thing all too soon" You muttered.

It only took a short while to reach the brig. Alanna was sitting at the back of her cell, the only person in the entire brig.
"Oh, look who we have here"
"So your Lt. Alanna Jamieson"
"And a right tootin correct you are! May I have the honour of knowning who I am speaking to?" She asked sarcastically, curtesying as she said honour.
"I'm Captain Macree. We need to talk"
"Oh, no first name basis for you? Lovely"

The Officer of Ceaser Station laughed. "Well, ye seem to be gettin' aloong quite nicely! I'll wait outside till ye make a decision?"
"Sure" You say, without turning to him.
The Officer walked out.

"Ah, all alone now are we?" Alanna asked. "How lovely."
"Stow it" You said firmly.
"Excuse me? There's thick bars between us, I dont think words will do anything here"
You stared deep into Alanna's deep blue eyes, trying to work out exactly what caused such a terrible personality for someone with such high qualifications.
"There's something unique about you"
"You too" She says, rolling her eyes. "You havent yet threatened to put me on the firing line yet. I'd advise you to go back and get a few more years training and then come and talk"
"Not that. Here's what I think. Your a simple girl who enrolled at the academy to hopefully fly a ship. Except your smarts eventually became a problem when all the academy teachers started to think too much of you and all suddenly everything comes flooding down on you because everyone thinks too damn much of a girl who rolls her tongue like a fourth grader. You like to insult others and riducle everyone in the general hopes that you can just fade away because ultimately your hoping to find a peace you sought from the beginning that you keep seeking but will ultimately never find. There is no hope for you, only a painful death awaits"

That hit Alanna hard. She shrunk back. Nobody had ever understood her quite like you had just done. Phew, that took some effort.
"So what!" She yelled. "Nobody cares about ME! Everyone just cares about my body and what I can do!"
"I care about you" You said quietly.
"Nobody ever cares about my feelings or my dreams or what I really want to do! They just want me to stand in line, salute like everyone else, yell like all the other captains, BE LIKE EVERYONE ELSE! I hate that!"
"Well for the record, I hate saluting as well" You said. That stopped her.
"Really?" She asked.
"Yea. I hate giving speeches as well. What I really like is a good crew member with good skills. But if they've got a boring simple mind then I dont want them. I'd rather have an interesting crew member with good skills rather than a boring crew member with amazing skills - any day"
Alanna blinked.
"So here's your options" You said. "Either you come with me, or you can stay and rot here. I might annoy you sometimes, but I can at least promise that you wont have to salute me once"
1113121.title: Lt Alanna Jamieson all alone in the brig...

11131211.content:
Alanna finally stood up and walked into the light that shone through into her holding cell. You could finally see what she really looked like, as the back of her cell was swathed in near complete darkness.
Her shoulder length black hair was disheveled and her dusty uniform had a rip down the side.

"How do I know that its worth coming with you?" She asked. Now close up to the bars, you noticed that her height only reached up to your eyes, meaning she had to look up a bit.
"Thats your catch. You don't know. I've only just had my new ship for nearly a day now and i've only had one mission. Either you come with me or you can rot in here. By the looks of it, you've been her a while"
"One month in two days - all on bread, old fruit and a little water. They don't send many supplies out this way" She said with a harsh edge in her tone. Alanna chewed her lip as she weighed the decision. Putting aside other events, she'd probably be attached to you and the ship for the remainder of her career.

"Alright, I'll come" She said.
"Sounds good. I'm pretty sure there's a tailor onboard who can get you a new uniform"
"Whats wrong with my current one?" She asked, looking at you right in the eyes. You didn't need to respond, you just pointed to the painstakingly obvious rip. "I'm not a fashionista, if there's a slight dishevel in someones uniform becuase they've been working hard, thats fine by me. But I don't think you'll get away with a rip that big on any ship"

You turned and left before she could respond.
"Aye! Your doone early laddie! So, we goin' ta flush her out into space?" Ceaser Stations C.O asked.
"No, she's coming with me" You said flatly.
The C.O's face dropped slightly. "Good luck with the lass. She'll really make you work for your money"
"Mhm, I've got a feeling that will happen"

You walked back inside with the C.O and he unlocked her door. Stepping out with a graceful walk that would have looked smart if not for the ripped uniform, she followed you back to your ship.
"So, I never actually found out what actually got you put in the brig for" You mentioned.
"Punched my Captain in the face"
"I'm sorry?" You asked in surprise.
"Was only in space for a month before this. He'd made a multitude of obvious tactical mistakes that cost the lives of so many men. Nobody ever thought him cut out as being a captain but there were rumors he bought his way in"

That was all you needed to know. You called the bridge on your communicator.
"Helmsman here" Came the response from Officer Jackson.
"Random question, we got a tailor on board?" You asked. There was a brief silence on board.
"Uhh... yea, one down on C-Deck"
"Send him... or her... whatever- to the airlock"
"Right away sir"

You arrived at the airlock connection your ship to the station in a matter of minutes. Your ships tailor in question was a short, gaunt balding man in a uniform that seemed to be pressed so hard it was the only thing keeping him standing up.
"Captain, how may I assist you?" He asked in a wrly manner. You wondered if the whole crew was going to be as unique as him.
"Take this woman and get her fitted for a Second Officer uniform"
"Pardon me sir, isn't your second officer Lt. Quentus?" He asked, tiliting his thin bald head slightly.
"Was - after that last mission, he took a direct hit"

The tailor nodded and quickly took Alanna by the hand. She quickly retracted her arm in disgust but he reached further forward and dragged her down the corridor towards the back of the ship. Meanwhile, you headed back to the bridge.
"Captain, Fleet Commander Horst want to speak to you" Officer Wilson said.
"In my dorm" You said, immediately turning to leave. Heading out of the Bridge, you entered your dorm where Horst was already waiting.
"So... I assume you took her?" He asked with a wry smile.
"Getting her a cleaner uniform as we speak"
"Excellent. I always knew I could count on you." He said. "I'm forward you your next mission documents. I'd like you to bear in mind that this whole mission is likely to take a week, perhaps even longer depending on the results"
"What am I getting into sir?" You asked.

"I'm sending you to the __________ System where you will immediately hide on the darkside of one of the planets - your free to pick which. Monitor which ships go in and out of the system but ensure that you do not approach ANY ship for any reason"
"Sounds easy" You said, nodding in agreement"
"Record everything, any ship that goes in or out, anything unusual that previous recon didn't pick up"
"Will do sir" You say happily. Horst nodded and hung up.

The relevant mission documents came through, indicating that the system you were travelling to was frequently traversed by rebel ships. Hopefully, this should be interesting. But where did Fleet Commander Horst send you?
11131211.title: Lt Alanna Jamieson joins the squad...

choices: The rest of the week goes peacefully
A patrol comes through the system!
111312111.content:
Horst was sending you the Rammina System. Apparently the rebels had a nice little shindig going here that they liked. You got up and headed for the bridge.
"Helmsman, set a course for the Rammina System. Activate Translight Drive"
"Yes Sir"

You once again entered the blackness of Translight. Lt Alanna entered the bridge only moments later. She stared at the portal, unfazed by it's inner murky darkness and outer swelling colours.
"I suppose you've done this before a few times" You muttered to her.
"Five or six times..." She said. "You get used to it after a while"

Alanna's hair had been combed and tidied up so it actually looked quite nice, reaching down to her shoulders with a perfect length cut all the way around. It seems your tailor also specialized as a hair stylist. That might be useful. Her uniform had also been replaced by a much new and better pressed version, the large rip now completely gone as if it had never existed.
"Officers, my ready room" You commanded.

Your Helm, Tactical and Comms officer filed into the small meeting room which was situated just behind the bridge. Alanna followed in close behind.
"Sorry Sir, whose this?" Your Tactical Officer asked. Alanna shot a dirty look at him.
"Your new Second-In-Command. Play nice, she bites" You said. Alanna smirked at that last remark. The Comms Officer went slightly white in the face.
You brought up a 3D star map of the Rammina System on the HoloTable.
"This is where we drop out Sir" Officer Jackson said, pointing a red dot that appeared and was then replaced by a 3D copy of your own ship.
"We're going to be sitting around here for a week" You said. "Command wants to know if the rebels bring anything interesting through this system"
"Fun..." Alanna said sarcastically. "One whole week of sitting on our butts"

The other three officers looked at her as if you ought to chop her head off. But you ignored her.
"Hide behind one of the planets and we'll begin our sensor sweep" You said.
"That one looks like it will give a good range for sensor sweeping" Officer Jackson said, touching a yellow-orange planet that flashed red when he put his finger on it.
"Only if we want to get radiation poisoning" Alanna said, raising an eyebrow and frowning. Jackson looked at her in confusion. She sighed. "If you'll permit me Captain, this planet is far better. The planet Jackson suggested is well too close to the sun - the radiation will kill us within a day. I'd advise this planet." She said, pointing to a further out planet that was blue. "It'll be just within sensor range for the next three weeks and the distance will give us better cover"

Alanna dragged the holographic ship over to the planet where it automatically started orbiting it.
"Good enough" You said. "Jackson, set a course for the second planet from the sun and plot an orbit that keeps us on the opposite side of the rebel supply line"

Everyone nodded and left, save for you and Alanna. When they had gone, she turned to you. The holographic solar system was the only thing seperating you two.
"He's not an idiot, most helmsman aren't fully aware of the distance you can get to a sun before it starts to kill you - just like my last Captain." She said, raising an eyebrow.
"I'd rather you not call me a captain in such a sarcastic manner though." You said.
"Apologies Captain" She said, with the same air of sarcasm. There was a dead silence in the room for five minutes before she burst out laughing. "Relax, I'm kidding" She said, walking out.

------

The entrance into the Rammina System was an easy one and your helmsman set a course for the planet that Alanna had suggested. Thirty minutes after achieving a safe orbit, Alanna worked with some tactical crew to convert a missile and turn it into a remote sensor. It was deployed successfully, giving you some extra sensor quality.

Three days into the scan and you noticed that the crew was getting just a little restless. Only twenty five ships had entered the system, each one a rebellion ship. While most of them were cargo ships, visual shots confirmed that they were of an unknown designation, twice as long as the usual rebel cargo ship that was encountered during missions.
"Send this back to Earth, see if they recognise it" You said, giving the pictures to your Comms Officer. He nodded and began scanning them.
111312111.title: Rammina System

choices: Someone else wants to join you and your dinner...
1113121111.content:
Earth hadn't contacted you for nearly a week now aside from confirming the recieving of the pictures. The crew's restlessness was evident, but didn't appear problematic. To combat a potential increase however, you had your second, Alanna, organise for a section of the hangar to temporarily be converted into a soccer pitch for off duty personnel. Despite a few bruises from hitting the hard metal, everyone's spirits almost immediately increased and they appeared much happier at work.

Alanna, however, never seemed to show whether or not she was happy about the workings of the ship. She always had her work and reports done first, making it look easy. Though, you suspected that her previous work was alot more mind-numbing.
"So what WAS your previous assignment like?" You asked, sitting down at a table infront of her one night at dinner. Cutting through the tender chicken with your knife and fork, you made a mental note that the cook should definately be complemented on his work.
Alanna held the piece of bread just in front of her mouth, about to eat it but instead consigning to twisting the roll in her fingers. "My previous assignment was back-breaking work for a different captain, very different to you. Why are you interested?" She asked.
"I want to know about my crew. I can't be expected to work efficiently with them if I don't know how their own mind works"
"Most captains don't care about their crew - it's below them"
"I'm different"
"Evidently"
"You accepted coming"
"You asked"
"I think I made a reasonable offer"
"So you think. But make sure you keep order around here. If people forget about the chain of command - so-it's-called, there won't be a captain for this ship" Alanna finished, swallowing the roll in it's entirety without biting it once.
"Is there something your not telling me?"
"Well, I can't speak for the crew. But for me personally, you know I don't like it when people order me around" She said, locking her eyes on you.
"I'm all to aware of that. Hey, at least I don't make you salute me"
"I wouldnt do it if I had too"
"Which I suppose is part of the reason for your incarceration on Ceaser Station?"
"Perhaps"
"Your mysterious"
"I've told you more than think"
"Evidently"

That word seemed to almost bite Alanna. She knew perfectly well that you were definately a match for her and her words, able to finish any scentence as soon as you wanted. This would be an interesting game. You sighed.
"How goes the sensor scans?" You asked.
"We're at dinner. You want to discuss work?" She asked.
"I'm trying to make conversation"
"Your not very good at it"
"But here we are, talking" You say, locking your eyes with her at the perfect time.

You had a fair point in that matter. Alanna smirked lightly.
"Seems your not as bad as my first impression"
"And what was your first impression?"
"Repugnant"

You rolled your eyes, that was how she viewed most captains, if not all.
"And what do you make of me now?" You asked.
"Still thinking" She finished. Standing up, she walked away with her tray, a slight sway in her step. A passing junior officer suddenly had her plate in his hands, and for a second, was about to call out unfair when Alanna suddenly turned around to you: "Take my advice" She said. "Pick something better next time". Winking, she turned around and left.
The junior officer looked at you for a second and then went to dispose of the plate.
1113121111.title: The rest of the week goes peacefully

choices: The engines exploded as it moved off, destroying the entire cargo ship...
The cargo hold jetisonned itself and imploded...
11131211111.content:
The week had finally ended - at least according to your mission schedule. You were just finishing up your mission report - extremely dull - and hoping that someone from Earth would contact you so you could be distracted from it for just a few minutes.

Luckily, the call came through.
"This is Earth High Command calling for the Captain of Rising Dawn" A young officer's face had appeared on your monitor.
"Captain here" You responded, straightening your uniform
"Please wait, I'll transfer you to the mission centre now"

The image showed static for a few seconds, then an unfamiliar face appeared. Unofficially, you were expecting Fleet Commander Jason Horst, but apparently that wasnt going to be happening at the moment.
"Morning Captain" The man said. "Glad your up and about. How's the mission going?"
"Pretty quiet, seen a few rebels come on through. Been pretty keen to do some fighting but we've stuck to the mission parameters as asked"
"Good work son. Well, you can relax now. Intel is pretty keen on what those new freighters might be hiding and where they are going. We've got some new orders for you"

"I'm ready, so is the crew"
"Excellent. Next time you see an unusual freighter come through, we want you to capture it. Learn anything you can about it, including where the darn thing is going and why"
"Sir?" You asked. "Anything specific we are looking for?"
"Excellent question. Anything you can find: Navigation data, ship information and whatever information you can find on whats in the cargo hold. Your welcome to use whatever means you deem neccecary to get the information, but just make sure you get it BEFORE you blow a ship up. While we believe they don't know about you yet, they are sure to come looking when one of the freighters doesn't turn up"
"Thanks sir. We'll get right on it"
"Excellent. When you get the information, high-tail it back to Earth" The man said, hanging up straight afterwards.
"Never a goodbye" You murmured.

Leaving your dorm, you called your officers into the ready-room and explained your plan. While your Comms officer, Tactical Officer and Helmsman asked numerous questions, Lt Alanna stayed silent in the shadows, either percieving the plan as being an utter failure or potentially a complete success. You hoped for the latter. When everything was complete, all your officers left to prepare except for Alanna.
"What do you think?" You asked.
"I've never seen this strategy before, it's a new one. So I'll have an opinion afterwards"
"If we all work hard, we'll all get dinner tonight"
"That's what all captains say, right before they die"
"Then it's time to break that saying"

-----

Everyone was on full alert when the next freighter arrived in the system. It was acompanied by a small corvette which seemed to boast more guns than defensive capabilities. Approaching from the dark-side of the planet, the Helmsman aimed for a perfect line intersecting the corvette. The Railgun had already been charged and your Tactical Officer fired off a round, decimating the ship into smithereens before it had a chance to raise it's shields.
The freighter was about to bug out, but a smooth aim across it's engine's by your tactical officer quickly put a stop to that.

The freighter was dead in the water, it's guard destroyed. Launching from the hangar, you, Alanna and five marines quickly latched onto the entry door with your small craft. The armoury officer had quickly outfitted your unit with a few assault rifles and one grenade between you. The marines stood a better chance at fighting due to their body armour but you figured that Alanna had something up her sleeve, especially since she ditched the rifle in favour of two pistols.

There was something about this woman that you hadnt quite fully figured out yet.

Forcing your way through the door by using a cutting laser, it fell down with a massive clang.
"Remember, pick your targets" You told the marines. The marine captain nodded and they burst through, ready to pick off anyone with a gun. You hoped that the crew of this ship would be able to stay alive, as you might need them to access certain computer functions.
All of a sudden, two guards appeared out of nowhere, firing at the marines. Their aim was terrible however and everyone managed to duck behind pillars and walls before they were shot.
Gunfire was exchanged between your party and theirs. Here it was discovered why Alanna favoured the pistols as she quickly cut down the two guards while the marines distracted them.

Working carefully but quickly to the bridge, one of the marines kicked the door down and they all filed through, forcing the crew to their knees.
"Captains not here, sir" The marine captain said. "Looks like he ran away"
"Alright. Secure this area, make sure we don't get jumped and I'll start searching" You say, starting to work on the computers. Fortuantely, this was one of your strengths. Alanna also got to work, holstering her weapons. The marines changed their position, ready for anyone to come running but also making sure the crew didn't do anything.

The plans you discovered were easy to access, but you checked that you were not being duped by some other well hidden file. Most of the schematics shown didn't make any sense, but it looked like this ship was delivering parts for a much bigger ship that was being constructed. Downloading all the details onto a seperate harddrive, you decided the next best thing was to go to the hangar just to make sure.

Two of the marines guarded you and Alanna, but you figured that Alanna could probably take care of the both of you quite easily. Entering the hangar, the details you found on the computer confirmed what looked like parts to a ship.
"I don't recognise this" Alanna said, sifting through some information on a computer terminal. "Seems like some new stuff they are building"
"Alright, I've got what we need, including visual confirmation. Let's fall back to our ship"
"Yes sir" A marine said. He called the captain on his radio and you all quickly moved back to your ship.

"Captain, what about the crew?" The Marine Captain asked.
"I've rigged one of the terminals" You replied, lightly smiling.
"I'm sorry?"
"Tell ya what, come to the bridge and you'll see"

Back on your own ship, you headed straight for the bridge. "Helmsman, set a direct course for Earth, Activate Translight drive. Begin when I arrive"
"Course laid in Captain" came the response.

The Marine Captain joined you on the bridge, interested in what you were talking about. The helmsman engaged the translight drive and you slowly moved in. But, just before you dissappeared from view, the cargo ship repowered up and...
11131211111.title: Weeks end, mission three

choices: They are blueprints for a massive, possibly impenetrable warship!
They are blueprints for a galactic weapon!
111312111111.content:
You caught sight of the Cargo Ship just before you went into Translight. Someone onboard, desperate to escape, had powered up the engines except you had already caused an unstable reaction inside the main reactor. The result was an immediate explosion upon ignition.

The Marine Captain smiled and shook his head as he left the bridge.

-----

Once your ship docked with Serenada Station high above your beautiful planet Earth, you personally handed over all the information you had gleaned from the vessel. Horst wasnt there to greet you, but a junior officer was.
"Hello Captain. Would you follow me please?"
"Certainly. Where do I deliver my package?" You asked.
"Where I am taking you"
"Lead the way then" You said happily.

The junior officer led you through the station to a large meeting hall, it was one of those new ones with the holographic projector installed in the middle of the table. Several men, none of whom you recognised, were already seated.
"Glad you could join us" The man at the head of the table said. "Please take a seat captain."
There was one empty chair roughly near the middle section of the table, so you sat down.
"If you could insert your datachip then we can review your data. I'm sure the contents will be very interesting."

You pulled the chip from your pocket and inserted it into the Holoprojector. Immediately, several files and blueprints started showing up, scanning rapidly through the various files.
"So this is what you recovered?" He asked.
"Indeed sir. I had a quick check through the logs and I decided that there was no way we could actually keep the ship. The rebels had rigged the ship to blow should it have strayed off course. If I had the time, I could have sent a team on board to clear it but with the number of ships passing through the area, that would not be easy to conceal"
"Your decision was well made. I believe what your recovered has far greater usefulness than the ship itself"
You looked at the man, only half understanding what he was talking about.
"But, formalities aside, I believe you don't know who I am yet. Pleasure to meet you captain, I'm Admiral Lance of the 252th Devision. We'll likely be working together for a long time in this war"
"Sir" You said, acknowledging him.
"Anyway, onto business" He said, turning back to the Holoprojector. He pushed several buttons on a small pad in front of him and the holoprojector briefly flickered. It backtracked and then start showing up simple blueprints, what looked like basic smelting principles. But then the documents suddenly became increasingly complicated, until once such plan revealed everything...
111312111111.title: The engines exploded as it moved off, destroyin...

choices: Volunteer to try sabotaging it from the inside...
1113121111111.content:
The blueprints finally stopped on the specifications for a ship you had never seen before.
"Well thats new" Lance said, leaning back in his chair. You remained silent, studying everything you could on the screen.
"This confirms what The Viserelay stumbled upon two months ago" Another man down the other end said. "If their initial scouting is correct, it's vastly increased in size"
"More likely, their closer to finishing it" Lance said.

You were still confused, but decided that now still was not the time to speak. Another man reached his hand out and touched a point with two of his fingers joined together. Then he seperated his fingers which caused the image to zoom into a section of the ship.
"I recognise those guns, a new model used by the rebel which we have desigated as RED-X091. We've only encountered a few and they have extremely powerful damage potential. However this ship appears to be equipped by about one hundred. It seems to be able to take on a whole fleet by itself and come out unscathed."

Lance looked hard at the weapons and you wondered if the scar on the left side of his face had faced off against it. His demeanour certainly changed at the mention of it.
"Then we can't face it in battle. Especially with the main fleet divided. I propose that we sent in a sabotage team to take advantage of the fact that it isnt finished." He said.
"With respect Admiral. This ship may not be finished, but the weapons and engines appear to be online. Getting inside will be extremely difficult and getting out will likely be harder. Our only chance is a surgical strike with ships" An older woman said. She had the sort of tone in her voice that suggested she looked down on Admiral Lance.
"Your suggestion is illogical Vamee. You yourself said that the weapons were online. Any ships that entered the area would likely be cut down in seconds. Unless you want my own division to go on a suicidal run" Lance said, annoyed.

Vamee maintained a grim silence. Her intentions were immediately obvious to everyone.
1113121111111.title: That's a big ship...

choices: Head out immediately to sabotage the ship...
Take a days rest, there's no rush yet...
11131211111111.content:
"I can get in there" You said after an awkward minute of silence. Everyone stared at you but you maintained your stance.
"You've never done a mission like this before" Someone said. You ignored them.

"This is like the Corbulo run that we had to do in basic"
"In basic, if you got shot you could try again" Lance said, looking straight at you without any expression. You suspected something but held back asking.
"In basic, if we got shot, we didn't do anything for a week which drove us nuts. Then we learned how to not get shot"
Lance smiled slightly at the corners of his mouth.

"How is it like the Corbulo Run then? He asked. "Show me"
"Sorry, but I'm not familiar with that one" Someone asked. A few others nodded. They appeared quite a bit older than you.
"It's a new one as far as I know" You explained. "Part of the advanced training for infiltration and sabotage. The course is a month long and it's not easy. But after two tries, I managed to get me and a partner in there and cause quite an explosion. Nearly got kicked out for hurting several cadets."
"Oh?" Someone else asked.
"The basic instruction is to get into a ship" You said, manipulating the holoprojector to show your plan.
"First, you need to find a not so obvious gaping hole in the ship. Hangars are too well guarded and it's blatantly obvious that a docking connector won't work. But what about the ship vents?" You asked rehtorically. "We had to get inside a CCR Capital ship, each of which has a small maintenance entrance right at the back, between the four engines.
"You'll be cooked alive" The same man said.
"Not so. There's a small section of space where the heat actually cancels itself out, right in the middle. And, since the engines arent actually doing anything, they'll be idle, just like having a stove cooker on the lowest possible setting before you can turn it off." You continued. "The maintenance hatches arent well guarded because almost nobody knows about them"

You brought the diagram up on the massive rebel ship and showed the everyone on the holoprojector.
"The engines would create a big bang, but there's alotta people down there. Fortunately, I know a few things about vents, which has a large entrance right near the maintenance hatch. We can literally walk through some of them which I plan on doing. After a fair walk, we reach centre of the ship."
"Which is the main power relay" Lance said quietly.
"Cause an overload..." You started.
"...By feeding the power back into the distributor..." Lance said.
"...which eventually feeds back into the engine..." Vamee added.
"...blowing the ship to kingdom come" You then finished.

Lance looked at everyone else around the table, they had no problems with this plan.
"Very well Captain, the job is yours. Who's your partner on this mission?" Lance asked. You smiled lightly.
"Are you kidding? I'm taking Lt. Jamieson."
"I know that she got assigned to you and I'd advise against it. She's a real problem from what I hear"
"I know, she's a got a problem with everything. But maybe a little violence is what I need" You chuckled.
11131211111111.title: Volunteer to try sabotaging it from the inside...

choices: You drop down into the room first...
Alanna drops down into the room first...
111312111111111.content:
"I've got all the information that I need, I can go now if that's alright" You said.
Lance nodded. "Meeting adjourned" He said.

Everyone stood up and looked at you, keen to see how well you'd perform. Shaking Admiral Lance's hand, you then walked out of the meeting room back to your ship, the junior officer once again guiding you through the maze of halls in the station.

"Helmsman, you've been transmitted co-ordinates, take us there and find us a nice place to hide. Jamieson, my ready room" You said, walking onto the bridge and immediately walking out.
Your helmsman immediately plotted the course and took you into Translight. Alanna signed off something on a datapad and handed it to one of your junior officers who prompty left the bridge. She then followed you into your ready room to find out what was going on.

"This is a little forward" She said, leaning against the wall. "You havent even told us where we are going"
"As far as everyone High Command is concerned, we are actually the only two allowed to know what this mission is about." You explained. Walking over to the holoprojector, you brought up the schematics for the new Rebel Vessel. Alanna whistled.
"That's big" She said. "We going to blow it up?"
"Knew you'd say that, and yes we are. Gonna blow the whole thing to smithereens"
"Judging by the side weapons, our ship won't get close"
"We can't use our ship, it's going to hide at a nearby planet or something. Us two will then take a small landing craft with a single pilot." You said. Then you proceeded to explain your plan about using the rear maintenance hatch to access the large vents on the ship.
"There's a hatch there? I didn't know that"
"Large ships have them, including CCR Capital ships. I discovered one when I had to get on board for a training excercise." You said. "Figured this might work just as well."

Alanna looked at the ship, occassionally changing the view to look at different angles. "This is an impressive ship, but it doesn't look like the standard rebel design" She said after a while.
"What do you mean?"
"Their ships are more rugged... strong, but rugged. This ship is sleek. I.F.O.H sleek."
"You think the designs were stolen?" You asked.
"Wouldnt surprise me. I'll see you in the hangar bay." She said, walking out of the ready room. You'd never understand that woman.

Ten long hours later, you arrived at the co-ordinates you had been given. It was a star not previously plotted on I.F.O.H maps.
"What is that thing?" Your tactical officer asked, looking out the front window. The large ship was fully in view, easily dwarfing the smaller ships around it. Your helmsman wasted no time in turning the ship though, moving to the rear of a small moon orbiting a planet, fully hidden from sensors.
"Your getting faster at that" You said, commending your helmsman.
"Thank you sir" He said.
"While I'm gone, Tac's in charge"
"Sir?" Your tactical officer asked. "Shouldn't Lt. Jamieson be in charge?"
"She's with me"
"Very well then sir"

-----

Rifle's wouldnt help on this mission, you and Alanna would look to obvious with them. She, like before, settled with two pistols and you took just one with you. A larger model to hers with greater strength but longer firing time.
"Ready?" She asked, straightening her top. While you thought uniform would still be neccecary wherever you were, Alanna had stubbornly strippped down to a black tanktop and black leather jeans. She wore no markings or badges to signify her status and her long hair had been let down. You noticed that her body was a little... different, now that she was out of uniform. She was alot more slimmer than you had previously thought.
"Still think you should wear something a bit more" You said dejectedly.
'Is that an order?" She asked. You stayed silent.
Meanwhile, you had changed into a black uniformed top, preferring to stay at least within the near boundaries of your allowed uniform requirements. However, you had stripped yourself of your badges and markings to not give away your status.

Boarding the dropship you previously ordered ready, the pilot moved down out of the hangar bay into the blackness of space. Aside from knowing where to dock, your pilot knew nothing due to the secrecy of the mission. Moving right up the rear of the ship, you expected the sensors to be distorted by the heat, thus masking your trail.

The pilot maneuvered the craft up to the hatch and latched on, lowering metal clamps all the way around allowing you to freely enter without having to put on space suits. With a small cutting torch, you broke open the hatch and clambered inside with Alanna. The hatch slammed closed behind you and the pilot disengaged as prior instructions. Getting out of here would be all up to you and Alanna.

"So, where's your little vent?" Alanna asked. The whole corridor was empty, not even the sound of workmen pacing up and down.
"Hopefully somewhere around here" You said, walking forward. After two rights and one left, you eventually found it. With the same portable cutting torch, you broke it off and entered.
The vent was only just as tall as Alanna, meaning that you had to tilt your head slightly.
"This is where the long walk is" You said. She nodded, replacing the grate in a haphazard formation. Trudging through the near darkness, you occasionally looked down to see various other corridors on the ship. The path was easy, as nearly all of the other paths that randomly appeared were blocked by rotating fans that you couldnt bypass.
After an hour, you finally reached the point where you were sure you were above the main power grid. The heat had risen dramatically.
"Here it is" You said, looking down through a grate to see a mass of machines, each individually distributing power throughout the ship as neccecary.
"So how do we redirect the power?" Alanna asked.
"I'll show you" You said.
111312111111111.title: Head out immediately to sabotage the ship...

choices: A warning indicates a malfunction, your heading straight for the planet!
All goes to plan, welcome back to your ship...
1113121111111111.content:
From what you could see, the large room was completely empty. Nobody needed to be here as the machines were autonomous.
Kicking the grate out, you then sat on the edge and jumped down into the room, landing perfectly.

After doing a quick scout, you came back and beckoned Alannna down. Using the same method, she dropped down. Unfortunately, her top accidentally caught on a loose piece of metal. She landed with a thud, not making it as well as you. Then she slowly stood up, her arms wrapped around her naked chest.
"You lost your shirt" You said slowly.
"Not just that" She said, annoyed. "And if you laugh, I'll hit you"
"You'll have to take your arms away to do that" You said, stifling the laugh.
"Whatever, let's get this over and done with" She said, still annoyed.

You showed Alanna how to take the floor panels off and manually redirect the current flow all back into the same power line which led back into the engines. That was one done with about nineteen left to go. You started on the left side of the room while Alanna took the right side. This did require her to take her arms away, but you decided to not look, just for her sake.

You finished the last one and went to help Alanna as she was only halfway. Your prior experience had made you able to do it twice as fast as the first time and the method was no different. After working on the last one with Alanna, you both stood up.
"Still awkward" She said.
You were hesitant to do this, but you took your own uniform shirt off and tossed it to her. She gratefully took it, promptly turned around and put it on. It didn't fit her well at all but it was better than nothing. Then she turned back and a shocked look on her face appeared.
"What's that?" She asked.
"What?" You asked her.
"On your back" She added.
"It's nothing"
"That doesn't look like nothing"
"I'll explain later"
"You better"

On your back were about twenty to thirty erratically placed deep scars, most of which went across the centre. The story was long and would be better explained later when you had more time.
"We can't use the vents anymore, we're gonna have to find another way out of here"
"Then where do we go?" She asked.
"Well, by now everyone would have noticed the severe lack of power throughout most of the ship so anyone with a gun or a wrench will be heading here very soon. That leaves the hangars nearly empty." You said. "Then, in about two hours when they still can't figure out the powerloss, the ship goes kaboom"
"Kaboom?"
"Bang, boom, pop, big explosion time" You said. "The big one"
"Ah" Alanna replied. "Should be nice to watch"

Heading out of the distribution room, you and Alanna snuck into a side room which appeared to be for storage. Sure enough, a large number of boots and shouting was heard outside as people headed for the distribution room.
"Sucks to be them" Alanna snickered.
"Yea" You said, going down a small flight of stairs and opening a pressure sealed door to another corridor, also empty.

Walking carefully down the corridors, avoiding anyone you saw, you eventually found a console with a map that could take you to the nearest hangar bay. The system was behaving very erractically, the screen flickering constantly. All due to the severe lack of normal power. The lights also began to flicker and several went out completely, giving you the aid of darkness as you headed for the hangar bay. This was all too easy, just like Corbulo on your second round.

"Here we are" You said, looking through the open blast door into the hangar"
"Hey, whats that?" Alanna asked, pointing to a small craft that looked like a fighter jet.
"Dunno, looks like fun. Wanna steal it?" You said, smiling lightly.
"Sure, looks like a double seater." She said.

The hangar was completely empty aside from the various jets docked in here. Everyone must have gone to find out why everything had suddenly become dark.

You clambered onto the craft and lifted up the cockpit hood. Alanna had been wrong, it was a single seater.
"Damn. And this is the only one that looks like it's working" She said, looking at all the others which all looked out of service due to the mess of machinery and cables criscrossing them.
There was no time though, someone was coming. You clambered into the craft and pulled Alanna in, making her sit on top of you. It was extremely uncomfortable, but at least it worked.
"Ow!" She said, annoyed. "What the hell!"
"Someone was coming, this was the only option" You said. Alanna was still very annoyed.
Using the best of your intuition, you powered up the craft and shot the hangar door open with three of the onboard missiles. An alarm sounded, indicating the pressure breach.

Your craft was quickly sucked out into space, along with a multitude of other objects and busted jets.
Assuming what the controls were, you powered out and away from the new Rebel Super Ship and headed to the planet where your own ship was docked.
"So, comfortable?" You asked, finally relaxing.
"What do you think?" Alanna asked. You didn't have a response for that.

"This might take a while, better get comfortable" You said after a few minutes of silence, letting go of the controls and relaxing in your seat under the weight of Alanna. She huffed and leant back against you.
"Surprisingly comfortable" She whispered, promptly falling asleep.
1113121111111111.title: You drop down into the room first...

choices: A craft from your ship has found you. Your saved!
11131211111111111.content:
With Alanna asleep on top of you, you make an attempt to contact your own ship using the built in communication system. Unfortunately, it didn't appear to be working so after a few belated attempts, you gave up.

Only a few minutes later, a warning light appeared.

"LOW FUEL" It kept blinking.
"Dammit" You said.

Almost just as quickly, it indicated that you had no fuel. Well, what a fat load of good it did to say that you were low on fuel. And here you were now, spiraling out of control directly to the planet. What a great day this turned out to be. Nudging Alanna, she woke up.
"Home yet?" She asked.
"Not quite. Looks like we're gonna crash"
"What did you do?" She asked annoyed.
"Ran out of fuel" You said. "How is that my fault?"
Alanna shook her head. "Never mind."
"I'm going to try and glide down. Hopefully we can shake some of this speed in the atmosphere."

The terrible sensors on the craft indicated that the planet in question did sustain an atmosphere similar to Earth, though less oxygen and much lighter gravity. There was hope yet.

Using the barely working manuvering thrusters, you aimed the ship for the curve of the planet, rushing through the atmosphere towards the planet in a very similair manner to how the old spacecraft used to glide down. This craft, however, was ill suited for the task and everything began to heat up.
"Brace yourself" You said, wrestling with the control stick.

The craft hit the top of a mesa, smashing it's underside against the solid rock. You continued to glide in the air for a short while, before crashing into the ground, coming up for one last time and then hitting the ground again.
The cockpit lid blew off and the seat jumped about twenty centimeters in the air. Worst ejector seat ever.

Alanna stumbled out of the craft and collapsed on the sandy ground. The whole planet was a yellow desert, nothing but the odd rock for miles. Not even a cactus in sight. Blood flowed from her nose and there were several bruises on her arms and legs.
"Ow" She said, flopping down into the sand. You slowly made your way off the craft and sat down beside her, leaning against your crashed ship.
"Well, could have been worse" You said.
Alanna rested herself on the craft beside you.
"We're alive, thats enough for me" She said quietly.

Your first concern, however, was the blood flowing from her nose and several other areas. Ripping off pieces of the bottom of your pants, you forced her to hold them against the open wounds. It was the best you could do to keep the sand out of it and hopefully prevent infection. That was when Alanna noticed your back.
"Your bleeding" She said.
"I'm fine"
"Your entire back is caked with blood and it's dripping onto the sand at a big rate. Let me see it"
"Not until your okay"
"I'll live, you need to use something to strap up your broken foot"
"What?" She said, looking down at her left foot which had several black patches on it.
"The bone is broken" You said. "Seen it before"
Alanna hadn't even noticed it until now.
"Unless you set it right, it'll fix itself at an odd angle." You said, slowly, feeling a little woozy. Leaning forward, you twisted Alanna's ankle before she could stop you. She let out an earsplitting scream as you fixed the bent foot, setting it into a much better position.
"Yeouch!" She said. "But, thanks. Much better now"
"Yea..." You said, leaning back and passing out.

-----

You jerked awake suddenly. You were in a different position, face down in the sand with a piece of material to keep your face directly out of it. Alanna was beside you.
"Each one of these scars has split open. I'm not sure what you did to get these, but they are really bad. I don't understand how you can even walk with all this" She said, treating the wound with a bit of water from a canteen she had found in the crashed ship. It hurt, alot. You did your best to keep the screams in, but this was much better than bleeding to death.
11131211111111111.title: Red blinking lights... something isnt right...

111312111111111111.content:
"Want to hear the story then?" You asked. Talking would keep your mind off the pain.
"Yes, if thats okay" Alanna said, leaning against a tall rock. The sun had passed overhead and was setting in the east. You must have been out for at least two hours now.

"I don't normally like to talk about it, but I think I can trust you"
"Oh?"
"I got these because I disobeyed orders - direct orders. But the result was my entire team getting out alive. Something that doesn't happen often. I was part of Team Seven at the training academy of Geneval"
"You trained on Escario?" Alanna asked in surprise.
Escario was a very hostile world where the jungle forests were constantly trying to reclaim their territory which had been stripped to make way for a training academy. The Geneval Training academy.

"Yea. Lovely place. Don't want a summer home there though" You said, laughing weakly. "Anyway, Team Seven and I had nearly finished survival training. We had one last test left, which was the real survival test."
Alanna stayed silent.
"They sent drones into the sky above one of the northern forests to check for anything super dangerous. They came back with the all clear so all of our twenty teams were dropped in the middle of the forest. Each team had to seperately reach an outpost and carry an important package there without losing it. Sounds pretty easy, right? Well, there was only just enough food and water to keep us going and we had nothing else. The package was quite heavy so we shared the load every few hours."
"I know that course, I did a similar one on Harmony" Alanna said.
"Yea, it's pretty much the same for all the academys. Anyway, after three days, we estimated that we were nearly there. After having climbed a mountain, we saw the outpost in the distance. After another hours walk, Katie heard a noise"
"Noise?" Alanna asked.
"Yea, like, non-standard noise"
"As in..."
"Rannivore"

Alanna gasped. Rannivore's were extremely rare creatures that lived on a few planets. They had been seeded by pirates and were excellent at tearing through anything. An easy comparison was a rancor from the famous series "Star Wars", except a Rannivore was bigger, meaner and much more hungry. It also had four eyes which was something the science boys loved investigating. Rannivores had a cry which made it very distinct from other animals. Basically, if you heard one, you ran.

"We picked up the pace, I was holding the package. Q used the emergency communicator and called the outpost, saying that we had heard a Rannivore. The cries happened multiple times and the outpost didnt believe us until they heard it through the comms. There was nothing they could do because they didnt have any weapons to fight it off. All they could really do was protect us when we arrived. Terrible, but true. So we hiked for another ten minutes before it suddenly appeared and blocked our way.

The damn thing ran at us, looked really hungry, and grabbed John. It picked him up and would have eaten him if I hadnt chucked a rock at the ugly things eye. He didnt like that, so he drops John on the ground and goes for me. I threw the package to Katie and she said that the outpost had told us to run, don't fight it. So I said: 'No way. Gotta stop it now or it'll go after the other teams'. So screamed at my team to run and get away. They were hesitant at first so I threw rocks at them." You said, laughing at the last part.

"The Rannivore picked me up, but I was ready. I dragged a really big rock up with me and just as he was about to eat me, I dropped it in his mouth. It smashed a couple of teeth before it became stuck in his throught. They roar really werid when they have stones in the throat. He drops me, onto my front, and comes down and slashes my back. Naturally, Worst. Pain. Ever. Of all time. It then choked to death and eventually, I dragged myself to the outpost. The outpost commander was ready to reprimand me for disobeying orders but instead said I did well. Then I passed out"

"So what happened to Katie and Q and the others?" Alanna asked.
"Q originally had your job until our first mission went badly. As for Katie, John and Jerry? No idea. I was the only one who made captain so I suspect their working on some other ship. Wouldnt be surprised if Jerry was made into a tactical officer. He loved explosions."

"Thanks captain, good story"
"Yea. Glad I could tell someone again, Jamieson" You said weakly.
"Please, don't call me that" Alanna said softly.
"Mhm?"
"Reminds me of my father, very high up, very secretive, very popular. People always compare me to him" Alanna said dejectidly.
"Alright. What DO I call you then?" You asked. "Because I know that you don't want me to call you a lieutenant"
"Just call me Alanna"
"First name basis huh? I can live with that" You said, then passing out.
111312111111111111.title: Story time: Survival Training...

1113121111111111111.content:
It was early next morning when Alanna refreshed the 'bandages' on your back. You woke with a start.
"Just getting fresh coverings" She said. "No need to panic"

Not five minutes later, a small dropship raced above your crashsite. It slowed down a few hundred meters ahead and came back around. It landed on a flat section of ground only fifty meters away and someone immediately stepped out.

Your tactical officer, a pistol in hand ready to shoot someone. As soon as he saw you two though, he holstered his weapon and ran over.
"We monitored the ship as it went down over the planet, except the magnetic field here is interfering with our sensors so we didn't know what happened. It took a while to reconfigure the shields on the dropship so that we could safely come down" He said.
"Well, good that you did come" You said, wincing in pain.
"How did he get those scars?" Wilson asked.
"Long story, not going to talk about it" Alanna said. Wilson shrugged his shoulders and went back to the ship for a combat stretcher.

-----

Not forty minutes later the medics had swarmed you when you left the dropship in the hangar. They made several needle jabs into your back without even telling you what exactly they were doing. Still face down, you turned your head and noticed Alanna following behind with one of the doctors as you headed to the medical bay.
"These scars down his back werent from the crash, but thats why they opened. I don't have this on my medical record of him" He said to Alanna.
"I know" She replied softly.
"Whatever the case, we can treat him to be as good as new. However, unless he undergoes extensive surgery, those scars will remain. I'm very concerned that they'll rip open again. The skin is extremely tender."
"I also know that. What can you tell me that I don't know?"
"It'll take a few hours, then he's all yours again to go around crashing things" The doctor said sarcastically. Alanna stopped at the door to the medical ward as two doctors prevented her entry, then locking the door behind them. A doctor put a mask to your face and you then blacked out.

-----

You slowly blinked your groggy eyes open, looking up to see the familiar sight of your private dorm.
You sat up and looked around. The wound on your back still hurt slightly, but it was more than manageable. Getting changed into your captains uniform again, you headed for the bridge.
Everyone was at their stations, ready for anything. Alanna looked up from her own chair and gestured you to your own.
"Thanks" You said.
Alanna's calm and somewhat kind attitude from the planet had once again turned into the stern and demeaning voice she had once you first met her.
"I've already plotted our course back to Earth to deliver the report. Apparently there was quite an explosion due to our mission" She said. Your helmsman piloted the ship into Translight and you were off.
1113121111111111111.title: Next morning...

11131211111111111111.content:
Exiting from Translight only a few hours later, you saw the beautiful blue and white jewel of Earth. Your helmsman, Jackson, piloted the ship up to the orbiting station you had previously docked with and the docking tube connected.

"Lt. Jamieson, with me" You said.
You left the ship and headed back onto the station, where the same junior officer greeted you and led you to the same meeting room. Everyone was where they had been before, as if they had never moved in the first place.
"Why is she here?" Vamee asked.
"Stow it" Admiral Lance said. "Jamieson was the captains second on the mission."
"Which explains why the mission took so long" Vamee sneered.
"One more out of you" Lance said angrily "And you can say goodbye to last years little birthday present.
Vamee sunk in her seat, defeated. You noticed a hint of sadness in Alanna's facial expression as she was compared to her father once again, but she quickly hid it behind her stoic attitude.

"I'm pleased to report that the ship is destroyed" You reported. "However, as Lt. Jamieson told me, the design is concerning"
"How so?" Lance asked, folding his arms. You gestured for Alanna to explain
"It's not Rebel design. They typically stick with whatever they can get to work without worrying about design. This was a very sleek, very modern design. It had many similiarities to an I.F.O.H designed vessel." She said.

'She speaks?' You heard someone whisper. If Alanna heard it, she didnt respond. However, Lance did and his brow furrowed as he shot dagger eyes at one of the men at the table.

"I don't know if there are any new vessels of ours currently being developed, but I suspect this was a stolen design" Alanna continued.
"I'm aware of the lab boys working on a few new ships" One of the women beside Lance said, "But nothing on this scale."
"Nothing top level secrecy?" You asked. There were blank stares around the room. "Look, you can tell me if there is or not. I'm not going to go hunting for it because to be honest, it doesn't worry me. If they try again, I'll just use the same tactic."
"Assuming it works" Lance said.

Lance sighed and shook his head. "I don't care what other people at this meeting say" He said, eyeing Vamee. "But you have done an excellent job. Take a weeks downtime and you''ll be sent some new mission documents"
"Thank you sir" You said. Alanna left the room.
"Oh, and, Captain?" Lance said, just before you left.
"Sir?"
"Try not to crash again any time soon" He said with a grin.

You caught up to Alanna, who was marching back towards the ship, obviously quite angry but doing her best not to show it.
"I think I understand now" You said slowly. Alanna ignored you.
